div.a: Ohio Department of Education Releases Parents and Caregiver Resources

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: Click the link below to view the Parent and Caregiver Resources that have been released by the Ohio Department of Education. These resources

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

div.span: are available to support engaging students in learning during the school-building closure period.

span.style: color: #1c1e21; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff
span.a: CLICK HERE TO VIEW PARENT/CAREGIVER RESOURCES

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Coshocton Elementary School

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Academic Expectations Per Week

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: To: All CES Parents:

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: From: Dave Skelton, Principal

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Date: April 6, 2020

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This is our fourth week without students. We receive new information every day and it is sometimes overwhelming. I am certain you have had this feeling many times. We want to help by providing a structure of what is expected, how much is expected, and how often it is expected.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: 4 days a week, your student in grades K-2 should be getting:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of ELA instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of Math instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of Science or Social Studies instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Related Arts instruction and activities

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: 4 days a week, your student in grades 3-6 should be getting:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of ELA instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 60 min of Math instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Science instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Social Studies instruction and activities

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: "Noto Sans Symbols", sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No more than 30 min of Related Arts instruction and activities

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: One day a week, students will

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: not be given any new assignments

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: , but instead will be provided potential extension activities or extra support time to catch up on their work. Our teachers will still be available to help students from 9:00-2:00PM. All of our teachers can be contacted by email and they will respond asap. You should have their email address. If not, please call our school office at 622-5514 between the hours of 9:00-2:00PM. Again, teachers are available Monday-Friday from 9-2 for any questions or concerns. If you need help outside of that time, please email, and they will respond as soon as possible. We are here to help our students, so do not hesitate to contact the teacher by email.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please keep in mind that we want to be supportive of your child’s learning and want to make sure we are attentive to their emotional health during this time. Let us know if you are struggling and we can help support you during this unexpected closure. As you know, parents need to help to their children during this time. Please use your judgement to guide your children as they work so they do not become anxious or overwhelmed. It is alright for children to need a break while working on an assignment.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Please know that you are in my thoughts and trust that we will be here to help you and your children.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Sincerely,

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Dave Skelton

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Principal

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

div.a: CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD THE CES STUDENT ACADEMIC EXPECTATIONS

br.span: Kindergarten registration has been postponed until further notice. Please continue to watch our website and social media sites for further information.

div.a: All Call Message from the Superintendent - April 3, 2020

span.style: color: #666666; font-family: Arial, sans-serif

span.span: The Governor has extended the Stay at Home order through May 1st, so we will continue with our current process through this month of April. I know this is a tough situation for everyone involved, and I want to say THANK YOU to all of our students and parents. You are to be commended for your hard work over the past few weeks. You are doing a great job and we will continue to make adjustments to student assignments to keep this new method of learning from becoming overwhelming and stressful. Students and parents can continue to receive assignments through teacher communications and through postings on our website. Please let your teachers or building administrators know if you are having any issues. We will work to resolve these as soon as possible. Thank you for helping with these assignments as we work to continue the learning process. We know these can be very stressful times and we appreciate your patience and understanding. Stay safe. We will get through this because we are Coshocton Strong!

p.span: On a different note, next weekend is Easter, and next Friday, April 10th is a holiday so there is no school for students or staff on Good Friday. There will be no assignments on Friday, April 10th. Please enjoy the day with your family. Thanks for listening and have a great evening!
